# isMember(of:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is an instance of a given class.

## Declaration

```swift
func isMember(of aClass: AnyClass) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **aClass**: A class object representing the Objective-C class to be tested.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES] if the receiver is an instance of `aClass`, otherwise [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO].

## Discussion

For example, in this code, [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObjectProtocol/isMember(of:)] would return [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO]:

```objc
NSMutableData *myData = [NSMutableData dataWithCapacity:30];
id anArchiver = [[NSArchiver alloc] initForWritingWithMutableData:myData];
if ([anArchiver isMemberOfClass:[NSCoder class]])
    ...
```

Class objects may be compiler-created objects but they still support the concept of membership. Thus, you can use this method to verify that the receiver is a specific Class object.

## Testing Object Inheritance, Behavior, and Conformance

- **isKind(of:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is an instance of given class or an instance of any class that inherits from that class.
- **responds(to:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver implements or inherits a method that can respond to a specified message.
- **conforms(to:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver conforms to a given protocol.
